definition: front-line/forward position/outpost/extending ahead/frontier (of science, technology etc)
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
along/to follow (a line, tradition etc)/to carry on/to trim (a border with braid, tape etc)/border/edge

sentences.english: The command post was set up in a forward position.
sentences.chinese: 指揮部設在前沿陣地上。

sentences.english: They may look like an ordinary pair of spectacles, but these glasses are at the forefront of a revolution in eyewear.
sentences.chinese: 它們看起來像普通的眼鏡，但是是眼鏡改革的最前沿。

sentences.english: The enemy attacked our foremost positions all night.
sentences.chinese: 整整一夜敵人攻打了我們的前沿陣地。

sentences.english: It has been at the forefront of eight leading industry innovations for underground trackless equipment.
sentences.chinese: 也一直走在地下無軌設備8大工業創新的最前沿。

sentences.english: Study on optical sub-wavelength structure has been a subject of great interest in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 光學亞波長結構研究是受國際重視的研究前沿。

sentences.english: The decisive attack took off fromthe foremost position.
sentences.chinese: 決定性進攻是從最前沿陣地開始的。

sentences.english: Cloned livestock are the next frontier in biotech farming.
sentences.chinese: 克隆家畜成爲生物技術農業下一個前沿。

sentences.english: The deposits are grouped close to the present-day erosional edge of Kombolgie Formation rocks.
sentences.chinese: 礦牀集中於靠近科姆波爾吉地層巖的現代侵蝕前沿。

sentences.english: How has China vaulted to the forefront in manufacturing, trade and technology?
sentences.chinese: 中國如何躍至製造，貿易和技術的前沿？

sentences.english: Do you desire to sense the contemporary first-class and vanguard prospect?
sentences.chinese: 你想感受到一種當代東西的一流前沿圖景嗎？

sentences.english: Glycobiology has been recognized as "the last frontier" in biochemistry.
sentences.chinese: 糖生物學被認爲是生物化學領域“最後的前沿”。

sentences.english: The investigation of the optical spatiotemporal pattern is a forward topic in nonlinear scientific field.
sentences.chinese: 光學時空斑圖也是當今非線性科學領域內的前沿課題。

sentences.english: What industry particularly appreciates is research that explores new frontiers of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 工業界特別重視那些探索知識的新前沿的研究。

sentences.english: Latest universe research news, cosmos topics and other science discoveries & technology improvements.
sentences.chinese: 介紹宇宙的前沿研究與宇宙學進展及相關科技動態。

sentences.english: Based on today'sstate-of-the-art-science, what is your opinion?'
sentences.chinese: 根據今天的前沿科學觀念，你的看法是什麼？

sentences.english: Mr Sunstein calls it a "frontiers question".
sentences.chinese: 桑斯坦因稱其爲一個“前沿問題”。

definition: depth (from front to rear)/depth (into a territory)/span (of time)/(fig.) depth (of deployment, progress, development etc)
place of origin/source (of a war or a social movement)
to crane one's neck/to await eagerly/to lead/to show the way
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
to be ahead of one's time/to surpass or outdo one's predecessors/to be ahead of the pack/to take the lead/advanced
to impel/to carry forward/to push on/to advance/to drive forward
